result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas James Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent; AS TO EACH COUNT, with credit for 167 days

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and with WI Substances Abuse program but only after serving 4 years of the sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: $50.00 payable to Danny B. JOINT AND SEVERAL WITH CO-ACTORS, FIRST PRIORITY

EACH COUNT: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge and any victim surcharges. All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain full-time employment/education/vocation.
- No Contact with the victims specified in the Criminal Complaint or the c-actors.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Obtain GED.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas James Wells

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant regarding DNA surcharges.
Original Transcript (20 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing 07-31-2015 received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas James Wells in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Nicholas James Wells in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Counts 1, 2, 3 and 4:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with 167 days credit CONCURRENT to all other Counts; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program but only after serving 4 years of the sentence.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with the victims specified in the Criminal Complaint or the co-actors.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Obtain GED.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $50.00 payable to Danny B. joint and several with co-actors, first priority.; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on abudget plan.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter from defendant received and filed.

Defendant Nicholas James Wells in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Nicholas James Wells in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
As to Counts 1-4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

At the request of the defense attorney, and without objection from the court or the State plea hearing scheduled for 05/27/2015 at 8:30am is converted to plea AND sentencing 05/27/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Nicholas James Wells not in court, in custody.  Thomas Potter for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas James Wells in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Nicholas James Wells in custody.  Ron Dague for Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Gena Malanche-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss COUNTS 3 AND 4 is argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Emily G., Jonathan B., Harry N., Marquis M., Daniel B., Kimberly Meyer, Anthony Zydzik, Lori Wilbur, or Adalberto Hernandez.

Defendant Nicholas James Wells in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Nicholas James Wells in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nicholas James Wells
Current: 6516 S. 35th St., Franklin, WI 53132   (Effective: 02-20-2015)
Prior: 426 North 34th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
